oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - Sierra Hull - 2017-07-23
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Musician spotlight program featuring Sierra Hull from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on July 23, 2017. Guest appearance by Justin Moses. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Sierra Hull; Justin Moses;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (04:32) Opening comments and introduction by Abigail St. Pierre / (08:54) Opening comments by Sierra Hull / (9:00) Performance of song possibly titled Charlotte's First - Weighted Mind (Sierra Hull - mandolin and vocal) / (15:15) Sierra comments about her feelings towards the Museum, talks about her background / (19:25) Introduces the next song / (19:44) Untitled Jig - Queen Of Sorrow / (26:37) Sierra talks about her admiration for Loretta Lynn / (28:26) Performs You Wanna Give Me A Lift / (31:50) Sierra introduces her husband Justin Moses / (32:41) Sierra talks about Justin / (34:33) Performs the song Cattle In The Cain (Sierra and Justin - mandolins) / (38:20) Sierra talks about gospel music influences / (39:19) Performs Wicked Path Of Sin (Justin - guitar) / (42:17) Introduces the next song / (44:46) Performs Azalea Waltz / (47:28) Answers question about adapting the mandolin to other styles of music / (48:25) Performs excerpt of the Prince song 1999 /

(50:29) Talks about using the mandolin as a time keeper in songs / (51:19) Answers question about how she and Justin met / (52:31) Answers question about Jethro Burns / (54:19) Justin answers question about the differences between a dobro and steel guitar / (56:55) Sierra talks about Flatt and Scruggs / (58:13) Performs Foggy Mountain Rock (Justin - dobro / (01:00:38) Answers question about the octave mandolin / (01:03:05) Performs Lullaby / (01:08:20) Performs Old Dangerfield / 01:12:21) Final comments / (01:12:37) Walk-out music / (01:14:47) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hull, Sierra; Moses, Justin; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
